episodes.natural_language:
Case: Fidel-Antonio-Bueso-Sandoval-MVA-06-13-2024. Client: Fidel Antonio Bueso Sandoval.

This note reflects an email chain related to the case. On July 10, 2024, at 09:52:10 AM Eastern, Aries Penaflor of Whaley Law Firm forwarded an email to Justin Chumbley (justin@whaleylawfirm.com) with the subject “Fwd: 17-69H4-72C.”

The forwarded message, originally sent on July 9, 2024 at 4:12 PM (time shown as 4:12?PM), came from HOME CLMS-STATEFARMCLAIMS and was addressed to aries@whaleylawfirm.com. In this message, State Farm Claims stated that they had received a representation letter for Fidel Biso. There is a limits issue on the file: liability limits are 25/50, and there were 10 people injured in the accident. They advised that they have accepted liability on behalf of their insured. The message concluded with thanks, from Abby Jett, Claims Specialist – Injury, who provided Direct: 309-834-5952 and Fax: 855-820-6318.

The message also included the sign-off from Aries Paul Peñaflor of Whaley Law Firm, including contact details: Ph: (502) 365-5788 and Fax: (502) 364-9363, ending with “All the best.”

Case Fidel-Antonio-Bueso-Sandoval-MVA-06-13-2024 involves client Fidel Antonio Bueso Sandoval in a motor vehicle accident matter. On July 18, 2024, Aries Penaflor of Whaley Law Firm forwarded correspondence to Fidel’s Filevine project email address regarding this case. The forwarded thread is titled “Fwd: 17-69H4-72C,” referencing State Farm claim number 17-69H4-72C.

The forwarded material includes an original message from AutoMedicalClaims@StateFarm.com dated July 17, 2024 (about 6:38 PM). The State Farm note instructs the recipient to open attachments for more claim information or next steps. It also cautions, for protection, not to include sensitive personal information such as Social Security numbers, credit/debit card numbers, driver’s license numbers, or health/medical information in email communications; if such information must be sent, the recipient should contact their claim associate to request a secure email channel.

The message further offers reminders about receiving calls related to the auto and homeowners claims: texting AUTO to 62789 will provide a claim contact card or allow download from a mobile device, and texting HOME to 62789 provides the same for homeowners. The note is signed by Anne Perez, identified as a Claim Associate (PIP/MPC) with the handle VAE65C and she/her pronouns. It also includes the closing from Whaley Law Firm’s representative, Aries Paul Peñaflor, with contact details: Whaley Law Firm, Ph: (502)365-5788, Fax: (502)364-9363. The email chain appears to have originated from State Farm and circulated to the Whaley Law Firm as part of the Fidel-Antonio-Bueso-Sandoval-MVA-06-13-2024 case file.

Case: Fidel-Antonio-Bueso-Sandoval-MVA-06-13-2024. The client is Fidel Antonio Bueso Sandoval, associated with a motor vehicle accident dated June 13, 2024.

The file contains a forwarded email thread beginning with a message titled “Fwd: Fidel Sandoval” from Jessica Bottorff of The Whaley Law Firm. The forwarding was addressed to Fidel Antonio Bueso Sandoval’s Filevine project email address FidelAntonioBuesoSandovalZ4639720@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.

Within the forwarded thread, ULH Customer Service responded on Tuesday, August 20, 2024, at approximately 8:43 AM to Jessica Bottorff with the subject “RE: Fidel Sandoval.” They stated that they were unable to locate the patient based on the name and date of birth provided and asked that the patient information be verified and the request resubmitted. The message was signed by Hallie, identified as a Customer Service Specialist in Accounts Receivable Operation, with the email Hallie.Hoback@uoflhealth.org.

Before that, on Monday, August 19, 2024, at 10:41 AM, Jessica Bottorff had sent a message to ULH HIM ROI and ULH Customer Service, with a copy to FidelAntonioBuesoSandovalZ4639720@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, under the subject “Fidel Sandoval.” The email included a security alert warning that the message was from an outside sender and advising caution with links, instructing recipients to report phishing using the toolbar. The body stated that an attachment contained a request for records and bills for Fidel Sandoval, and it was signed by The Whaley Law Firm.

On November 25, 2024 at 12:31 PM, Jessica Bottorff of Whaley Law Firm (712 Lyndon Ln., Louisville, KY 40222; fax 502-364-9363) emailed ULH Customer Service with the subject “Fidel Sandoval.” In that message, she included a security alert stating: “SECURITY ALERT! This message is from an outside sender! Please review with caution and only open links you know are safe. Please click the ‘Report Phishing’ button on your tool bar to report this message to the security team for review.” She indicated that they had received medical records on their client Fidel Sandoval but still needed the bill, and she noted that the after-visit summary was attached.

ULH Customer Service replied on November 26, 2024 at 9:03?AM with: “Your request has been received. Please allow 30days for processing. Sending additional requests by fax, mail, or additional emails will delay the process. If you have not received billing records in 35 days, you may call and check on the status.” The message was from ULH, signed by Hallie, a Customer Service Specialist in Accounts Receivable Operation.

On November 26, 2024 at 12:45:28 PM EST, Jessica Bottorff forwarded the above exchange to Fidel Antonio Bueso Sandoval’s Filevine project email address: FidelAntonioBuesoSandovalZ4639720@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, with the message subject “Fidel Sandoval.” The forwarded content reiterates that ULH had received the medical records but that the billing bill was still needed, and it confirms that the after-visit summary was attached. The original CC for Jessica’s message included FidelAntonioBuesoSandovalZ4639720@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com.
